func hepler(dp []int, n int)int {
    if n ==  0 {
        return 0

func fib(n int) int {
    if n == 0 {
        return 0
    }
    if n == 1{
        return 1
    }

    dp := make([]int, n+1)
    // base case
    dp[0] = 0
    dp[1] = 1

    // 
    for i := 2; i <= n; i++{
        dp[i] = dp[i-1] + dp[i-2]
    }

    return dp[n]
}

func coinChange(coins []int, amount int) int {
    // dp  dp[i] = value  ivalue
    dp := make([]int, amount + 1)
    dp[0] = 0

    return hepler(dp, coins, amount)

func hepler(dp, coins []int, amount int) int{
    // dp[amount]
    if amount == 0 {
        return 0
    }
    if amount < 0 {
        return -1
    }
    if dp[amount] != 0{
        return dp[amount]
    }

    //  dp[n] = min(dp(n-coin) + 1)
    res := 100000
    for _, coin := range coins {
        subproblem := hepler(dp, coins, amount - coin)

        //  
        if subproblem < 0 {
            continue
        }

        if subproblem < res {
            res = 1 + subproblem
        }
    }
    if res != 100000 {
        dp[amount] = res
    } else {
        dp[amount] = -1
    }

    return dp[amount]
}

dp tabledp[i] = value ivalue

func coinChange(coins []int, amount int) int {
    if amount == 0 {
        return 0
    }
    if amount < 0 {
        return -1
    }
    // dp  dp[i] = value  ivalue
    dp := make([]int, amount + 1)
    dp[0] = 0

    for i := 1; i <= amount; i ++ {
        // 
        dp[i] = 10001
        for _, coin := range coins {
            if i - coin < 0 {
                // 
                continue
            }
            dp[i] = min(dp[i], dp[i - coin] + 1)
        }
    }

    if dp[amount] == 10001 {
        return -1
    }

    return dp[amount]
}

func lengthOfLIS(nums []int) int {
    // dp[i] nums[i]
    //  dp[i] = idp[i-1]nums[i] > nums[i-1]  1
    dp := make([]int, len(nums))
    // 
    ret := -1
    for i := 0; i < len(nums); i ++ {
        // dp  1
        dp[i] = 1
        // dp[i]
        for j := 0; j < i; j ++ {
            if nums[i] > nums[j] {
                dp[i] = max(dp[i], dp[j] + 1)
            }
        }
        ret = max(ret, dp[i])
    }
    return ret
}

func maxSubArray(nums []int) int {
    if len(nums) <= 0 {
        return -1
    }
    // dpdp[i]nums[i]
    dp := make([]int, len(nums))
    dp[0] = nums[0]
    ret := dp[0]

    // 
    for i := 1; i < len(nums); i ++ {
        dp[i] = max(nums[i], dp[i-1] + nums[i])
        ret = max(ret, dp[i])  
    }

    return ret
}

func longestCommonSubsequence(text1 string, text2 string) int {
    if len(text1) == 0 || len(text2) == 0 {
        return 0
    }
    // dp[i][j] text1[0:i]  text2[0:j]
    // 
    dp := make([][]int, (len(text1)+1))
    for i := range dp {
        dp[i] = make([]int, (len(text2)+1))
    }

    ret := -1
    //  dp[i+1][j+1]dp[i][j]
    for i := 0; i < len(text1); i ++ {
        for j := 0; j < len(text2); j ++ {
            if text1[i] == text2[j] {
                //  text1[0:i]  text2[0:j]+1
                dp[i+1][j+1] = dp[i][j] + 1
            }else {
                // text1[0:i-1]  text2[0:j]
                //  text1[0:i]  text2[0:j-1]
                dp[i+1][j+1] = max(dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j+1])
            }
            ret = max(ret, dp[i+1][j+1])
       }
    }
    return ret
}

func max(a, b int) int{
    if a > b {
        return a
    }
    return b
}

 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func mergeTwoLists(list1 *ListNode, list2 *ListNode) *ListNode {
    // 
    head := &ListNode{}
    p := head
    for ;list1 != nil && list2 != nil; {
        // 
        if list1.Val < list2.Val {
            p.Next = list1
            list1 = list1.Next
            // list1  list1.Next,p.Next 
        } else {
            p.Next = list2
            list2 = list2.Next
        }

        // p 
        p = p.Next
    }

    // list1 
    if list1 != nil {
        p.Next = list1
    }
    // list2 
    if list2 != nil {
        p.Next = list2
    }

    return head.Next
}

K 

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func mergeKLists(lists []*ListNode) *ListNode {
    // 1
    // 1 
    // 2 n-1
    var merge func(lists []*ListNode, left, right int) *ListNode
    merge = func(lists []*ListNode, left, right int) *ListNode{
        // 
        if left == right {
            return lists[left]
        }
        if left > right {
            return nil
        }

        mid := (left + right) / 2
        l1 := merge(lists, left, mid)
        l2 := merge(lists, mid+1, right)

        return mergeTwoLists(l1, l2)
    }

    return merge(lists, 0, len(lists)-1)
}

func mergeTwoLists(l1, l2 *ListNode)*ListNode {
    head := &ListNode{}
    p := head
    for ;l1 != nil && l2 != nil; {
        if l1.Val < l2.Val {
            p.Next = l1
            l1 = l1.Next
        } else {
            p.Next = l2
            l2 = l2.Next
        }

        // p
        p = p.Next
    }

    // l1
    if l1 != nil {
        p.Next = l1
    }
    // l2
    if l2 != nil {
        p.Next = l2
    }

    return head.Next
}

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func partition(head *ListNode, x int) *ListNode {
    // x x
    head1 := &ListNode{}
    p1 := head1
    head2 := &ListNode{}
    p2 := head2

    for ;head != nil; {
        if head.Val < x {
            p1.Next = head
            p1 = p1.Next
        } else {
            p2.Next = head
            p2 = p2.Next
        }

        // head head.Next
        // p1 p2headhead.Next
        tmp := head.Next
        head.Next = nil
        head = tmp
    }

    // 
    p1.Next = head2.Next
    return head1.Next
}

N 

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func removeNthFromEnd(head *ListNode, n int) *ListNode {
    // n + 1
    // 
    newHead := &ListNode{}
    newHead.Next = head
    p1 := newHead
    p2 := newHead
    for ; p1 != nil && n >= 0; {
        p1 = p1.Next
        n--
    }

    for ; p1 != nil; {
        p1 = p1.Next
        p2 = p2.Next
    }

    // p2.Next
    tmp := p2.Next
    p2.Next = p2.Next.Next
    tmp.Next = nil

    return newHead.Next
}

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func middleNode(head *ListNode) *ListNode {
    //  2 1
    p1 := head
    p2 := head
    for ; p1 != nil && p1.Next != nil; {
        p1 = p1.Next.Next
        p2 = p2.Next
    }

    return p2
}

    /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func hasCycle(head *ListNode) bool {
    // hash
    nodes := map[*ListNode]bool{}
    for head != nil {
        if _, ok := nodes[head]; !ok {
            nodes[head] = true
            head = head.Next
        } else {
            return true
        }
    }

    return false
}

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func getIntersectionNode(headA, headB *ListNode) *ListNode {
    // 
    p1 := headA
    p2 := headB
    for ;p1 != p2; {
        if p1 == nil {
            p1 = headB
        } else {
            p1 = p1.Next
        }

        if p2 == nil {
            p2 = headA
        } else {
            p2 = p2.Next
        }
    }

    // 
    return p1
}

    p1 := head1
    head2 := &ListNode{}
    p2 := head2

    for ;head != nil; {
        if head.Val < x {
            p1.Next = head
            p1 = p1.Next
        } else {
            p2.Next = head
            p2 = p2.Next
        }

        // head head.Next
        // p1 p2headhead.Next
        tmp := head.Next
        head.Next = nil
        head = tmp
    }

    // 
    p1.Next = head2.Next
    return head1.Next
}

N 

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func removeNthFromEnd(head *ListNode, n int) *ListNode {
    // n + 1
    // 
    newHead := &ListNode{}
    newHead.Next = head
    p1 := newHead
    p2 := newHead
    for ; p1 != nil && n >= 0; {
        p1 = p1.Next
        n--
    }

    for ; p1 != nil; {
        p1 = p1.Next
        p2 = p2.Next
    }

    // p2.Next
    tmp := p2.Next
    p2.Next = p2.Next.Next
    tmp.Next = nil

    return newHead.Next
}

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func middleNode(head *ListNode) *ListNode {
    //  2 1
    p1 := head
    p2 := head
    for ; p1 != nil && p1.Next != nil; {
        p1 = p1.Next.Next
        p2 = p2.Next
    }

    return p2
}

    /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func hasCycle(head *ListNode) bool {
    // hash
    nodes := map[*ListNode]bool{}
    for head != nil {
        if _, ok := nodes[head]; !ok {
            nodes[head] = true
            head = head.Next
        } else {
            return true
        }
    }

    return false
}

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * type ListNode struct {
 *     Val int
 *     Next *ListNode
 * }
 */
func getIntersectionNode(headA, headB *ListNode) *ListNode {
    // 
    p1 := headA
    p2 := headB
    for ;p1 != p2; {
        if p1 == nil {
            p1 = headB
        } else {
            p1 = p1.Next
        }

        if p2 == nil {
            p2 = headA
        } else {
            p2 = p2.Next
        }
    }

    // 
    return p1
}

public static Properties initConfig() {
    Properties props = new Properties();
    props.put(ProducerConfig.BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_CONFIG, brokerList);
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Properties props = initConfig();
    KafkaProducer<String, String> producer = new KafkaProducer<>(props);
    ProducerRecord<String, String> record = new ProducerRecord<>(topic, "Hello, Kafka");

    try {
        producer.send(record);
    } catch (Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
